result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew W. Currey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew W. Currey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew W. Currey was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Rebecca C w/o her permission and permission of the agent.  3rd party transport contact is allowed for the purpose of any placement of the minor children.  No contact w/ any individuals who use or traffic illegal substances.  No contact w/ Charlene S or Don M.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - STILL DUE AND OWING
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given - STILL DUE AND OWING.   May Not have contact with Rebecca Curry or Charlene Steinke unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

Attorney Kelly Birschbach appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Corcoran.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Sentencing arguments heard.  The court imposes a total sentence of 30 months WSP; 18 months initial confinement and 12 months extended supervision w/conditions; no contact with Rebecca Currey or Charlene Steinke.  Credit for 592 days - time served on the initital confinement portion of the sentence.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.
Court reporter transcript invoice for 091615 sentencing paid by county $51.00.
Sentencing Hearing - 9/16/15

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:15am-  Victim rights compliance - victim is present.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  141 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court orders 9 months conditional jail w/ huber.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs, DV surcharge & DNA surcharge.  No restitution requested.  Appeal rights given.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:36pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 1 & 3 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
Due to issue with the court's calendar, 8/6/2015 Final pre-trial is moved to 1:30pm.  Matter is resolved.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:35am-  Victim rights compliance - alleged victim is present.  Attorney Edwards is requesting an adjournment to attempt to resolve the matter.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
